content:
Anyway to get the templates directory in the docker-zulip image?
I tried adding them in the custom_zulip_files/ dir, but they don't get added into the Docker container.

Using: image: 'zulip/docker-zulip:2.0.3-0'
@Geoff Wild by this, do you mean HTML templates?
Generally if you want to edit files with Docker, the recommended approach is to build your own custom image off a fork of zulip/zulip
In general, a normal VM will be a lot more convenient than using Docker if your intent is to patch the software, since the Docker model is built around the idea of immutable container images.
